root.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
root.content:
Natural Language Processing (NLP)

A field of AI that focuses on enabling computers to understand, interpret, and generate human language. It's the power behind virtual assistants, translation apps, and more.

quiz.question: What is the primary goal of Natural Language Processing?
options: To create new languages for computers.
quiz.answer: To enable computers to process and understand human language.

sentiment-analysis.title: Sentiment Analysis
sentiment-analysis.content:
Sentiment Analysis

The process of computationally identifying and categorizing opinions expressed in a piece of text, especially in order to determine whether the writer's attitude towards a particular topic is positive, negative, or neutral. Often used on social media and in product reviews.

quiz.question: A company analyzing customer tweets to gauge reaction to a new product is an example of:

machine-translation.title: Machine Translation
machine-translation.content:
Machine Translation

The task of automatically translating text or speech from one language to another. Modern systems like Google Translate use deep learning models (Transformers) to achieve high accuracy.

chatbots.title: Chatbots & Dialogue Systems
chatbots.content:
Chatbots & Dialogue Systems

These are computer programs designed to simulate human conversation through text or voice commands. They range from simple, rule-based bots to sophisticated virtual assistants like Siri and Alexa, and large language models like ChatGPT.

ner.title: Named Entity Recognition (NER)
ner.content:
Named Entity Recognition (NER)

A task that involves identifying and classifying named entities in text into pre-defined categories such as the names of persons, organizations, locations, medical codes, time expressions, quantities, monetary values, percentages, etc.
